Description: The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency announced a consent decree with Carmeuse Lime, Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, to resolve Clean Air Act violations at the company's Chicago lime manufacturing facility. The company will pay a $350,000 fine and spend $125,000 to replace windows at residences primarily in Chicagos East Side neighborhood.
Info Source: https://archive.epa.gov/epapages/newsroom_archive/newsreleases/50523e7dadc20ef885257aac007b4ce8.html

Description: The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency and Virginia's Department of Environmental Quality announced consent agreements with O-N Minerals (Chemstone) Company, a lime production facility in Strasburg, Va. The agreements resolve alleged violations of the company modifying its rotary kiln - - increasing air pollution emissions - - without installing the necessary pollution control equipment or obtaining required permits. O-N Minerals will pay two penalties, one of $158,980 to Virginia Department of Environmental Quality and another of $121,829 to the United States Treasury.
Info Source: https://archive.epa.gov/epapages/newsroom_archive/newsreleases/bc0bd401fe79d486852576b10063c2c9.html
